name: Quicksort
description:
A divide and conquer algorithm that sorts a list by continuously partitioning it into increasingly sorted sub-halves. Is in
general the fastest sort algorithm
steps: If the list has only one element, short-circuit.
Pick a number p to be the "pivot". Let pI = the index of the pivot

Partition the list such that all numbers < p are on the left side of the list and all numbers greater are on the right. At this
point p will be in its correct position in the list.
Repeat the same steps for sublists [0, pI) and (pI, list.size())
